text: CREATING AN ECONOMY THAT WORKS FOR ALL
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour’s economic strategy is about delivering a fairer, more prosperous society for the many, not just the few.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will measure our economic success not by the number of billionaires, but by the ability of our people to live richer lives.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour understands that the creation of wealth is a collective endeavour between workers, entrepreneurs, investors and government.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Each contributes and each must share fairly in the rewards.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: This manifesto sets out Labour’s plan to upgrade our economy and rewrite the rules of a rigged system, so that our economy really works for the many, and not only the few.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Britain is the only major developed economy where earnings have fallen even as growth has returned after the financial crisis.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Most working people in Britain today are earning less, after inflation, than they did ten years ago.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Too many of us are in low-paid and insecure work.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Too many of us fear our children will not enjoy the same opportunities that we have.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour will turn this around.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will upgrade our economy, breaking down the barriers that hold too many of us back,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: and tackling the gender pay gap.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Our National Transformation Fund will deliver the investment that every part of Britain needs to meet its potential, overcoming years of neglect.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Our industrial strategy will support businesses to create new, highskilled, high-paid and secure work across the country, in the sectors of the future such as renewables.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will stop our financial system being rigged for the few, turning the power of finance to work for the public good.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: And we will put small businesses at the centre of our economic strategy.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: The growth created by our national investment plan, underpinned by the responsible economic management embodied in our Fiscal Credibility Rule, will create good jobs,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: drive up living standards
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: and improve the public finances.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: It is a plan that will deliver Labour’s vision of an economy that works for the many, not just the few
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: – a Britain in which no one is held back.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: A FAIR TAXATION SYSTEM
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Taxation is what underpins our shared prosperity.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: All of us, including business, benefit from a healthy, educated and skilled population, with access to basic services and secure housing.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We believe in the social obligation to contribute to a fair taxation scheme for the common good.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will take on the social scourge of tax avoidance through our Tax Transparency and Enforcement Programme,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: and close down tax loopholes.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: But we will not ask ordinary households to pay more.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: A Labour government will guarantee no rises in income tax for those earning below £80,000 a year,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: and no increases in personal National Insurance Contributions or the rate of VAT.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Under Labour’s plans, 95 per cent of taxpayers will be guaranteed no increase in their income tax contributions, and everyone will be protected from any increase in personal National Insurance contributions and VAT.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Only the top 5 per cent of earners will be asked to contribute more in tax to help fund our public services.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We renew our pledge not to extend VAT to food, children’s clothes, books and newspapers, and public transport fares.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Corporation tax in the UK is the lowest of any major developed economy.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Our new settlement with business will ask large corporations to pay a little more while still keeping UK corporation tax among the lowest of the major developed economies.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: In turn, we will meet the business need for a more skilled workforce with extra corporate tax revenues while contributing to education and skills budgets.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will protect small businesses by reintroducing the lower small profits rate of corporation tax.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will also exclude small businesses from costly plans to introduce quarterly reporting
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: and take action on late payments.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour will give HM Revenue & Customs the resources and skills necessary to clamp down hard on those unscrupulous few individuals and companies who seek to avoid the responsibilities that the rest of us meet.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: BALANCING THE BOOKS
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Our manifesto is fully costed, with all current spending paid for out of taxation or redirected revenue streams.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Our public services must rest on the foundation of sound finances.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour will therefore set the target of eliminating the government’s deficit on day-to-day spending within five years.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: But government must have a laserlike focus on how we earn, as well as how we spend.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: At the same time as eliminating the current deficit, Labour will invest in our future, to ensure faster growth and help us to earn our way as a country again.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: To maintain good fiscal health, we will have a firm rule in place to guide all our taxation and spending decisions.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Our Fiscal Credibility Rule is based on the simple principle that government should not be borrowing for day-today spending,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: but that future growth depends on investment.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: It was designed in conjunction with worldleading economists.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: It also means we are committed to ensuring that the national debt is lower at the end of the next Parliament than it is today.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Compliance with the rule will be overseen by a strengthened and truly independent Office for Budget Responsibility, which we will make accountable to Parliament.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will also consult on implementing the recommendations of the Kerslake Review of the Treasury.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Our country and its people have been held back by a lack of investment in the backbone of a modern economy – the infrastructure of transport, communications and energy systems.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: And when investment has happened, it has been too concentrated in too few places.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour will make different choices.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will take advantage of near- record low interest rates to create a National Transformation Fund that will invest £250 billion over ten years in upgrading our economy.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will ensure that the huge potential of every part of our country is met.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: The next Labour government will rebuild communities ripped apart by globalisation and neglected for years by government.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will rebuild and transform our economy so that it works for the many, not the few.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: So we will put in place tight rules to ensure that investment is fairly shared around every region and nation of the UK.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will tear down the barriers that have held too many people back.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: A Labour government will complete the HS2 high-speed rail line from London through Birmingham to Leeds and Manchester, and then into Scotland, consulting with (and, where necessary, compensating) communities.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will link HS2 with other rail investments, such as Crossrail of the North (tying together our great northern cities) and on to the Durham Freight Centre.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will build a new Brighton Main Line for the South East.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: In London, to ensure our capital continues to prosper, we will build Crossrail 2.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: To harness the economic potential of new technologies and science, we will complete the Science Vale transport arc, from Oxford to Cambridge through Milton Keynes.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: And we will deliver rail electrification and expansion across the whole country, including Wales and the South West.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will transform our energy systems, investing in new, stateof-the-art low-carbon gas and renewable electricity production.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will deliver universal superfast broadband availability by 2022.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour will improve mobile internet coverage and expand provision of free public wi-fi in city centres and on public transport.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will improve 4G coverage and invest to ensure all urban areas, as well as major roads and railways, have uninterrupted 5G coverage.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: On day one we will instruct the National Infrastructure Commission to report on how to roll out'ultrafast’ (300Mbps) across the UK within the next decade.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: UPGRADING OUR ECONOMY: LABOUR’S INDUSTRIAL STRATEGY
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Our economy is suffering from years of neglect by governments that have refused to support our industries, businesses and workers.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: This wasted potential is holding us all back.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Inequality has ballooned as the economy has shifted towards low-paid, insecure jobs.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Britain’s manufacturing base has declined
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: and we have relied too heavily on the financial sector, centred on London and the South East.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: And while the South East struggles with a rising cost of living crisis, many northern and coastal towns have watched as their economies and communities are left behind.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Britain’s failure to get all its regional and local economies working can be seen in the deterioration of the country’s current account,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: weak productivity growth
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: and underinvestment in infrastructure.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Britain can only be stronger if every nation and region is given the resources and support to succeed.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Only a Labour government with a credible industrial strategy can reach this untapped potential and deliver prosperity to every corner of our country, working with devolved administrations.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Our industrial strategy will be built on objective, measurable missions designed to address the great challenges of our times.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: In meeting these challenges, we will move beyond the narrow approaches of the past, and mobilise the talents and resources of our whole country to deliver an economy fit for the future.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: The first missions set by a Labour government will be to: ensure that 60 per cent of the UK’s energy comes from zero-carbon or renewable sources by 2030
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: create an innovation nation with the highest proportion of highskilled jobs in the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development by 2030.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will meet the OECD target of 3 per cent of GDP spent on research and development by 2030.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: In order to create a fertile ground for businesses to achieve these missions Labour will take action across the areas we know are necessary for business and industry to grow:
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Skills - by creating a National Education Service for England.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Infrastructure – by investing £250 billion over the next ten years.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: UK supply chains - by targeting government support where there are gaps.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Trade – by negotiating a new deal with Europe that puts jobs and the economy first.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Procurement – by requiring the best standards on government contracts.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Research and development – by committing extra research investment.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Energy costs and security – by capping costs
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: and investing in new publicly owned energy provision.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: While our industrial strategy is one for growth across all sectors, Labour recognises that certain sectors are of strategic significance to the UK economy.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: For each strategic industry, the next Labour government will establish a council (modelled on the highly successful Automotive Council) to oversee its future security and growth.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will also encourage private investment by removing new plant and machinery from business rate calculations.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: National and local government spends £200 billion a year in the privatesector procurement.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour will put that spending power to good use to upgrade our economy,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: create good local jobs
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: and reduce inequality.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will require firms supplying national or local government to meet the high standards we should expect of all businesses: paying their taxes,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: recognising trade unions,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: respecting workers’ rights and equal opportunities,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: protecting the environment,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: providing training,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: and paying suppliers on time.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will expect suppliers to reduce boardroom pay excesses by moving towards a 20:1 gap between the highest and lowest paid.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will appoint a Digital Ambassador to liaise with technology companies to promote Britain as an attractive place for investment and provide support for start-ups to scale up to become world-class digital businesses.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Our Digital Ambassador will help to ensure businesses are ready to grow and prosper in the digital age.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: TRANSFORMING OUR FINANCIAL SYSTEM
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: A decade after the devastating international financial crisis, our financial system is still holding back too many of our small businesses and local economies.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour will transform how our financial system operates.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Following the successful example of Germany and the Nordic countries, we will establish a National Investment Bank that will bring in private capital finance to deliver £250 billion of lending power.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: This new public institution will support a network of regional development banks that, unlike giant City of London firms, will be dedicated to supporting inclusive growth in their communities.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: The banks will deliver the finance that our small businesses, co-operatives and innovative projects need across the whole country.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: The National Investment Bank will fill existing gaps in lending by private banks, particularly to small businesses,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: and by providing patient, long-term finance to R&D-intensive investments.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: It will also be given the task of helping to deliver our industrial strategy, by prioritising spending in line with its objectives.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour will overhaul the regulation of our financial system,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: putting in place a firm ring-fence between investment and retail banking that will protect consumers.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will take a new approach to the publicly-owned RBS, and launch a consultation on breaking up the bank to create new local public banks that are better matched to their customers’ needs.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: And we will extend existing Stamp Duty Reserve Tax to cover a wider range of assets, ensuring that the public gets a fairer share of financial system profits.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour will change the law so that banks can’t close a branch where there is a clear local need, putting their customers first.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Britain has a successful international finance industry, but we also need a strong, safe and socially useful banking system to meet the needs of our own regional economies and communities.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will commit to creating a more diverse banking system, backed up by legislation.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: A NEW DEAL FOR BUSINESS
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: The majority of businesses play by the rules: they pay their taxes and their workers reasonably and on time, and they operate with respect for the environment and local communities.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: That is why it is vital that government ensures that businesses doing the right thing are rewarded rather than undercut or outbid by those unscrupulous few that cut corners, whether on taxes, workers’ conditions, environmental standards, or consumer safety and protection.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: But our business culture doesn’t always work like this.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Scandals such as the failure of BHS show how the longterm growth of a company can be sacrificed for the sake of a quick buck.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: When shareholders are looking for quick short-term returns, they encourage companies to cut corners.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: That means they look to cut wages, instead of investing for the long term, or they spend longer inventing new tax avoidance schemes than they do inventing new products.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: By reforming the rules our companies operate under, we can make sure they stay focused on delivering shared wealth.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour will amend company law so that directors owe a duty directly not only shareholders, but to employees, customers, the environment and the wider public, and we will consult on bringing forward appropriate legislation within this Parliament.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour will amend the takeover regime to ensure that businesses identified as being'systemically important’ have a clear plan in place to protect workers and pensioners when a company is taken over.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour will also legislate to reduce pay inequality by introducing an Excessive Pay Levy on companies with staff on very high pay.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Our small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) are the backbone of our economy, providing 60 per cent of private-sector jobs.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Technological changes, like the spread of digital manufacturing and rapid communication, mean smaller, faster businesses will be the future of our economy.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Yet this Conservative Government has taken small businesses for granted.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour is the party of small businesses.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We understand the challenges our smaller businesses face.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: In order to provide the support many small businesses need, a Labour government will: Mandate the new National Investment Bank, and regional development banks in every region, to identify where other lenders fail to meet the needs of SMEs and prioritise lending to improve the funding gap.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Reinstate the lower small-business corporation tax rate.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Introduce a package of reforms to business rates – including switching from RPI to CPI indexation,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: exempting new investment in plant and machinery from valuations,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: and ensuring that businesses have access to a proper appeals process
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: – while reviewing the entire business rates system in the longer run.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Scrap quarterly reporting for businesses with a turnover of under £85,000.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Declare war on late payments by: Using government procurement to ensure that anyone bidding for a government contract pays its own suppliers within 30 days.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Developing a version of the Australian system of binding arbitration and fines for persistent late-payers for the private and public sectors.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will also bring forward legislation to create a proper legal definition for co-operative ownership.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: The National Investment Bank and regional development banks will be charged with helping support our co-operative sector.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour will aim to double the size of the co-operative sector in the UK, putting it on a par with those in leading economies like Germany or the US.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: WIDENING OWNERSHIP OF OUR ECONOMY
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Britain is a long-established democracy.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: But the distribution of ownership of the country’s economy means that decisions about our economy are often made by a narrow elite.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: More democratic ownership structures would help our economy deliver for the many and lead to a fairer distribution of wealth.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: In government, Labour would give more people a stake – and a say -  in our economy by doubling the size of the co-operative sector and introducing a “right to own,” making employees the buyer of first refusal when the company they work for is up for sale.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will act to ‘insource’ our public and local council services as preferred providers.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Many basic goods and services have been taken out of democratic control through privatisation.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: This has often led to higher prices and poorer quality, as prices are raised to pay out dividends.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: For example, water bills have increased 40 per cent since privatisation, and our private energy providers overcharged customers by £2 billion in 2015.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: In private hands, Royal Mail has increased stamp and parcel charges, and failed to meet its customer service obligations, while its owners trade shares at significant profit.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: The Conservative Government’s privatisation of Royal Mail was a historic mistake, selling off another national asset on the cheap.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Across the world, countries are taking public utilities back into public ownership.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour will learn from these experiences and bring key utilities back into public ownership to deliver lower prices, more accountability and a more sustainable economy.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will: Bring private rail companies back into public ownership as their franchises expire.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Regain control of energy supply networks through the alteration of operator license conditions, and transition to a publicly owned, decentralised energy system.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Replace our dysfunctional water system with a network of regional publicly-owned water companies.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Reverse the privatisation of Royal Mail at the earliest opportunity.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Public ownership will benefit consumers, ensuring that their interests are put first and that there is democratic accountability for the service.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: SUSTAINABLE ENERGY
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour’s energy policy is built on three simple principles: ·To ensure security of energy supply and ‘keep the lights on’.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: To ensure energy costs are affordable for consumers and businesses.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: To ensure we meet our climate change targets and transition to a low-carbon economy.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: The UK energy system is outdated, expensive and polluting.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Privatisation has failed to deliver an energy system that delivers for people, businesses or our environment.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: One in ten households are in fuel poverty, yet the Competition Markets Authority found customers are overcharged an enormous £2 billion every year.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour understands that many people don’t have time to shop around, they just want reliable and affordable energy.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: So the next Labour Government will: ·Introduce an immediate emergency price cap to ensure that the average dual-fuel household energy bill remains below £1,000 per year, while we transition to a fairer system for bill payers.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Take energy back into public ownership to deliver renewable energy, affordability for consumers, and democratic control.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will do this in the following stages: · Regaining control of energy supply networks through the alteration of the National and Regional Network Operator license conditions.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Supporting the creation of publicly owned, locally accountable energy companies and co-operatives to rival existing private energy suppliers, with at least one if every region.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Legislating to permit publicly owned local companies to purchase the regional grid infrastructure,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: and to ensure that national and regional grid infrastructure is brought into public ownership over time.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour will insulate four million homes as an infrastructure priority to help those who suffer in cold homes each winter.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: This will cut emissions,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: improve health,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: save on bills,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: and reduce fuel poverty and winter deaths.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Homeowners will be offered interestfree loans to improve their property.

text: Labour’s schools policy will be built on the following four foundations: ·Investment – we will make sure schools are properly resourced by reversing the Conservatives’ cuts and ensuring that all schools have the resources they need.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will introduce a fairer funding formula that leaves no school worse off, while redressing the historical underfunding of certain schools.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour will also invest in new school buildings, including the phased removal of asbestos from existing schools.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Quality – we will drive up standards across the board, learning from examples of best practice, such as Labour’s London Challenge, to encourage co-operation and strong leadership across schools.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We and trust in teachers and support staff professionalism to refocus their workload on what happens in the classroom.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Accountability – Labour will ensure that all schools are democratically accountable,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: including appropriate controls to see that they serve the public interest and their local communities.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will require joined-up admissions policies across local schools to enable councils to fulfil their responsibilities on child places,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: to simplify the admissions process for parents
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: and to ensure that no child slips through the net.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Inclusion – Every child is unique, and a Labour-led education system will enable each to find their learning path through a wide choice of courses and qualifications.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will invest in measures to close the attainment gap between children from different backgrounds.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: To give all children the best start in life, we will reduce class sizes to less than 30 for all five-, six-, and seven-year-olds, and seek to extend that as resources allow.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: To aid attainment, we will introduce free school meals for all primary school children, paid for by removing the VAT exemption on private school fees.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will abandon plans to reintroduce baseline assessments and launch a commission to look into curriculum and assessment, starting by reviewing Key Stage 1 and 2 SATs.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: The world’s most successful education systems use more continuous assessment, which avoids ‘teaching for the test’.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will tackle the teacher recruitment and retention crisis by ending the public-sector pay cap,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: giving teachers more direct involvement in the curriculum,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: and tackling rising workloads by reducing monitoring and bureaucracy.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will also consult on introducing teacher sabbaticals and placements with industry to encourage interaction between education and industry and introduce broad experiences into the classroom.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will reintroduce the Schools Support Staff Negotiating Body and national pay settlements for teachers.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will put £150 million back into supporting our children in schools by scrapping the Conservatives’ nonsensical plans for schools to pay the apprenticeship levy.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will extend schools-based counselling to all schools to improve children’s mental health, at a cost of £90 million per year.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: And we will deliver a strategy for children with special educational needs and disabilities (SEND) based on inclusivity,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: and embed SEND more substantially into training for teachers and non-teaching staff, so that staff, children and their parents are properly supported.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: SKILLS
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: At a time when technology is changing demand for different kinds of skills, and evolving patterns of work mean that people are more likely to pursue several careers during their working lives, it is crucial that our education system enables people to upskill and retrain over their lifetimes.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: As part of our dynamic industrial strategy, lifelong training will deliver productivity and growth to the whole economy while transforming the lives of individuals and communities.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: To ensure that we deliver for every part of the UK, we will devolve responsibility for skills, wherever there is an appetite, to city regions or devolved administrations.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Further and Adult Education
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Despite claiming to be committed to delivering high-quality training, the Conservatives have ruthlessly cut funding for FE colleges – our main provider of adult and vocational education – and reduced entitlements for adult learners.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: This has led to diminishing numbers of courses and students, and plunged the sector into crisis.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour would introduce free, lifelong education in Further Education (FE) colleges, enabling everyone to upskill or retrain at any point in life.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Our skills and training sector has been held back by repeated reorganisation, which deprives providers, learners and employers of the consistency they need to assess quality.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour would abandon Conservative plans to once again reinvent the wheel by building new technical colleges, redirecting the money to increase teacher numbers in the FE sector.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We share the broad aims of the Sainsbury Review but would ensure vocational routes incorporate the service sector as well as traditional manufacturing, working in tandem with our broad industrial strategy to deliver for the whole economy.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will improve careers advice and open up a range of routes through, and back into, education, striking a balance between classroom and on-the job training, to ensure students gain both technical and soft skills.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: To implement the Sainsbury recommendations, we would correct historic neglect of the FE sector by giving the sector the investment – in teachers and facilities – it deserves to become a world-leading provider of adult and vocational education.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: More specifically, we would: ·Bring funding for 16 to18-year-olds in line with Key Stage 4 baselines, while ensuring that the budget is distributed fairly between colleges and school sixth forms
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Restore the Education Maintenance Allowance for 16 to 18-year-olds from lower and middle income backgrounds
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Replace Advanced Learner Loans and upfront course fees with direct funding, making FE courses free at the point of use, including English for Speakers of Other Languages (ESOL) courses.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Drive up quality and consistency in the FE sector by:
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Encouraging co-operation and leadership across colleges and sixth forms, improving curriculum breadth and quality
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Setting a target, backed up by funding, for all FE teaching staff to have a teaching qualification within five years.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: In recognition of the role played by private-sector providers, we would extend support for training to teachers in the private sector
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Increase capital investment to equip colleges to deliver T-levels and an official pre-apprenticeship trainee programme.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Apprenticeships
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Employer-led training is the most effective way of meeting our growing skills gap.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour supports the apprenticeship levy, but will take steps to ensure that every apprenticeship is of a high quality.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour will: · Maintain the apprenticeship levy while taking measures to ensure high quality by requiring the Institute for Apprenticeships and Technical Education to report on an annual basis to the Secretary of State on quality outcomes of completed apprenticeships to ensure they deliver skilled workers for employers and real jobs for apprentices at the end of their training.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: And we will work with the devolved administrations to improve the operation of the levy
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Set a target to double the number of completed apprenticeships at NVQ level 3 by 2022
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Give employers more flexibility in how the levy is deployed, including allowing the levy to be used for pre-apprenticeship programmes
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Guarantee trade union representation in the governance structures of the Institute of Apprenticeships
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Protect the £440 million funding for apprenticeships for small-and medium-sized employers who don’t pay the levy
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Set targets to increase apprenticeships for people with disabilities, care leavers and veterans,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: and ensure broad representation of women, BAME, LGBT and people with disabilities in all kinds of apprenticeships
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Consult on introducing incentives for large employers to over-train numbers of apprentices to fill skills gaps in the supply chain and the wider sector
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Reverse cuts to Unionlearn
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Set up a commission on Lifelong Learning tasked with integrating further and higher education.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: HIGHER EDUCATION
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour believes education should be free, and we will restore this principle.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: No one should be put off educating themselves for lack of money or through fear of debt.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: There is a real fear that students are being priced out of university education.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Last year saw the steepest fall in university applications for 30 years.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Since the Conservatives came to power, university tuition fees have been trebled to over £9,000 a year,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: and maintenance grants have been abolished and replaced with loans.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: The average student now graduates from university, and starts their working life, with debts of £44,000.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour will reintroduce maintenance grants for university students,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: and we will abolish university tuition fees.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: University tuition is free in many northern European countries, and under a Labour government it will be free here too.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: A FAIR DEAL AT WORK
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Work should provide people with security and fulfilment.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: But for too many people work is insecure and does not make ends meet.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: The Conservatives boast about the recovery of employment, but our labour market is failing.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Real-terms pay is still lower than before the crash,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: and jobs are increasingly low skilled and insecure.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: A Labour government will invest in enforcement through a new Ministry of Labour,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: and empower workers and their trade unions – because we are stronger when we stand together.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: So we will review the rules on union recognition so that more workers have the security of a union.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: At the same time as strengthening workers’ rights, we will make work more fulfilling by using public investment to upgrade our economy and create high-quality jobs.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: While the Conservatives stand back and allow insecure work to spread, Labour will act to guarantee good jobs and businesses.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: RIGHTS AT WORK
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: The next Labour government will bring in a 20-point plan for security and equality at work:
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Give all workers equal rights from day one, whether part-time or full-time, temporary or permanent – so that working conditions are not driven down.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Ban zero hours contracts – so that every worker gets a guaranteed number of hours each week.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Legislate to ensure that any employer wishing to recruit labour from abroad does not undercut workers at home – because it causes divisions when one workforce is used against another.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Repeal the Trade Union Act and roll out sectoral collective bargaining – because the most effective way to maintain good rights at work is collectively through a union.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Guarantee trade unions a right to access workplaces – so that unions can speak to members and potential members.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Propose four new public holidays – bringing our country together to mark our four national patron saints’ days.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: These will be additional to statutory holiday entitlement so that workers in Britain get the same proper breaks as in other countries.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Raise the Minimum Wage to the level of the Living Wage (expected to be at least £10 per hour by 2020) – for all workers aged 18 or over, so that work pays.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: End the Public Sector Pay Cap – because public sector workers deserve a pay rise after years of falling wages.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Amend the takeover code to ensure every takeover proposal has a clear plan in place to protect workers and pensioners – because workers shouldn’t suffer when a company is sold.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Roll out maximum pay ratios of 20:1 in the public sector and in companies bidding for public contracts – because it cannot be right that wages at the top keep rising while everyone else’s stagnates.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Ban unpaid internships – because it’s not fair for some to get a leg up when others can’t afford to.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Enforce all workers’ rights to trade union representation at work – so that all workers can be supported when negotiating with their employer.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Abolish employment tribunal fees – so that people have access to justice.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Double paid paternity leave to four weeks and increase paternity pay – because fathers are parents too and deserve to spend more time with their new babies.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Strengthen protections for women against unfair redundancy – because no one should be penalised for having children.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Hold a public inquiry into blacklisting – to ensure that blacklisting truly becomes and remains a thing of the past.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Give equalities reps statutory rights – so they have time to protect workers from discrimination.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Reinstate protection against third party harassment – because everyone deserves to be safe at work.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Use public spending power to drive up standards, including only awarding public contracts to companies which recognise trade unions.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Introduce a civil enforcement system to ensure compliance with gender pay auditing – so that all workers have fair access to employment and promotion opportunities and are treated fairly at work.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: A Labour government will ensure Britain abides by the global Labour standards of the ILO conventions.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: All workers should be able to work in a safe environment and return to their families at the end of the day.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour will enforce regulations that save lives.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: As well as legislating against zero hours contracts, there are many more workers on short hours contracts (some only guaranteed a few hours per week), but who regularly work far more.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will strengthen the law so that those who work regular hours for more than 12 weeks will have a right to a regular contract, reflecting those hours.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will also scrap the changes brought in by the Conservatives in 2014 to TUPE, which weakened the protections for workers transferring between contractors,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: and we will abolish the loophole to the agency workers regulations known as the Swedish derogation.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will consult with employers and trade unions on legislating for statutory bereavement leave, for time off work after the loss of close family members.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will also consult on toughening the law against assaulting workers who have to enforce laws such as age-related sales or ticketing arrangements, and who face regular abuse.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour will maintain the ACAS Early Conciliation System to try to solve workplace issues efficiently,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: and we will protect the current compromise on Sunday trading hours.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour will also legislate to permit secure online and workplace balloting for industrial action votes and^internal union elections.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Workers in Britain are among the easiest and cheapest to make redundant, meaning when multinational companies are taking decisions to downsize that British workers are at a disadvantage.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will consult with trade unions and industry on reviewing redundancy arrangements to bring workers in Britain more into line with their European counterparts.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Stagnating incomes have forced many to take on more debt.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour will introduce a version of Scotland’s Debt Arrangement Scheme to give breathing space to households struggling with high debts.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: SELF-EMPLOYED WORKERS
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Self-employment can bring many benefits, freedoms and flexibilities to people – and is a vital and often entrepreneurial sector of our economy.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: But there is also mounting evidence that workers are being forced into self-employment by unscrupulous employers to avoid costs and their duties to workers.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour will clamp down on bogus self-employment by: · Shifting the burden of proof, so that the law assumes a worker is an employee unless the employer can prove otherwise.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Imposing punitive fines on employers not meeting their responsibilities, helping to deter others from doing the same.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Involving trade unions in enforcement, e.g. by giving them a seat on the executive board of the new Ministry of Labour.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Giving the Ministry of Labour the resources to enforce all workers’ rights.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Banning payroll companies, sometimes known as umbrella companies, which create a false structure to limit employers’ tax liabilities and limit workers’ rights.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Giving employment agencies and end-users joint responsibility for ensuring that the rights of agency workers are enforced.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Rolling out sectoral collective bargaining and strengthening trade union rights, because empowering people to claim their own rights in the workplace is the most effective means of enforcement.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We would also extend the rights of employees to all workers, including shared parental pay, making a substantial and immediate difference to the quality of life of people in insecure work.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: But there are real concerns that rapid changes to the world of work are rendering existing employment categories outdated.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour recognises that the law often struggles to keep up with the ever-changing new forms of employment and work, so we will set up a dedicated commission to modernise the law around employment status.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: New statutory definitions of employment status would reduce the need for litigation and improve compliance.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: The commission will be led by legal and academic experts with representation from industry and trade unions.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: SOCIAL SECURITY
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: After seven years of rising poverty and inequality, Labour will rebuild and transform our social security system.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Like the NHS, our social security system is there for all of us in our time of need, providing security and dignity in retirement and the basics in life should we become sick or disabled, or fall on hard times.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: DIGNITY FOR PENSIONERS
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour will always be on the side of pensioners and help ensure security and dignity for older people in retirement.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: As the Conservatives abandon their commitments to older people, Labour will guarantee the state pension ‘triple lock’ throughout the next Parliament.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: It will rise by at least 2.5 per cent a year or be increased to keep pace with inflation or earnings, whichever is higher.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: The Winter Fuel Allowance and free bus passes will also be guaranteed as universal benefits.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will protect the pensions of UK citizens living overseas in the EU or further afield.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Over 2.5 million women born in the 1950s have had their state pension age changed without fair notification.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: These women deserve both recognition for the injustice they have suffered and some kind of compensation for their losses.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Alongside our commitment to extend Pension Credit to hundreds of thousands of the most vulnerable women, Labour is exploring options for further transitional protections, to ensure that all these women have security and dignity in older age.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: This must never happen again.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour will legislate so that accrued rights to the basic state pension cannot be changed, but future benefits can.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: The pension age is due to rise to 66 by the end of 2020.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour rejects the Conservatives’ proposal to increase the state pension age even further.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will commission a new review of the pension age, specifically tasked with developing a flexible retirement policy to reflect both the contributions made by people, the wide variations in life expectancy, and the arduous conditions of some work.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We’ll restore confidence in the workplace pension system and put people rather than profit at its centre.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour will end rip-off hidden fees and charges,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: and enable the development of large efficient pensions funds, which will mean more cash for scheme members
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: and lower costs for employers.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: A Labour government will commit to an immediate review of the mineworkers’ pension scheme and British Coal superannuation scheme surplus, sharing arrangements between government and scheme beneficiaries.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: DIGNITY FOR THOSE WHO CAN NOT WORK
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Poverty in Britain is rising due to the Conservatives’ attempts to balance the books on the backs of the poorest.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: They have slashed social security over the last seven years, leaving more people in poverty, subject to a punitive sanctions regime, and reliant on food banks.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour will act immediately to end the worst excesses of the Conservative government’s changes.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will: · Scrap the punitive sanctions regime
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Scrap the Bedroom Tax
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Reinstate Housing Benefit for under-21s
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Scrap cuts to Bereavement Support Payment.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: The cuts to work allowances in Universal Credit (UC), and the decision to limit tax credit and UC payments to the first two children in a family, are an attack on low-income families and will increase child poverty.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour will reform and redesign UC, ending six-week delays in payment and the ‘rape clause’.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: With nearly four million children currently living in poverty, the majority in working families, we will commit to tackle child poverty with a new Child Poverty Strategy.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: The Tories have completely failed on their promise of making work pay
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: and on tackling the barriers to work faced by people with disabilities.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour supports a social model of disability.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: People may have a condition or an impairment but they are disabled by society.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We need to remove the barriers in society that restrict opportunities and choices for people with disabilities.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will build on the previous Labour government’s commitment to people with disabilities in 2009 as signatories to the UN Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities, and incorporate it into UK law.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour will repeal the following cuts in social security support to people with disabilities through a new Social Security Bill published in ourfirstyear in office.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will: · Increase Employment and Support Allowance (ESA) by £30 per week for those in the work-related activity group,
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: and repeal cuts in the UC limited capacity for work element.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Increase Carer’s Allowance by £11 to the level of Jobseekers’ Allowance.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Implement the court decision on Personal Independence Payment (PIP) so that there is real parity of esteem between those with physical and mental-health conditions.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Scrap the Work Capability and Personal Independence Payment assessments and replace them with a personalised, holistic assessment process that provides each individual with a tailored plan, building on their strengths and addressing barriers.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour will end the privatisation of assessments.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: End the pointless stress of reassessments for people with severe long-term conditions.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Commission a report into expanding the Access to Work programme.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: We will change the culture of the social security system, from one that demonises people not in work to one that is supportive and enabling.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: As well as scrapping the Conservatives’ punitive sanctions regime, we will change how job centre Plus staff are performance-managed.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017

text: Labour will strengthen access to justice for people with disabilities by enhancing the 2010 Equality Act, enabling discrimination at work to be challenged.
title: For the many not the few. The Labour Party manifesto 2017
